title: Map of Estevanicos Route - explain course concept

content.description:
Route of Estevanico, an Enslaved African Ladino from Morocco, Circa 1528

From west to east and north to south, the map shows:

the Pacific Ocean

most of North America

the northern part of South America

the Atlantic Ocean

southwestern Europe

northwestern Africa

The following cities are labeled:

Cibola in west central North America

Mexico City in southern North America

Galveston in south central North America

Santo Domingo on an island between North and South America

Estevanicoâ€™s Route:

Begins in northwestern Africa

Travels north to southwestern Europe

Crosses the Atlantic Ocean to Santo Domingo

Travels north then west to Galveston

Travels west then south to Mexico City

Travels north to end in Cibola
content.question:
Respond to parts A, B, and C.

Describe the role played by Africans such as Estevanico during the colonization of the Americas.

Explain how Atlantic Creoles were similar to or different from another group of Africans in the diaspora.

Explain how the work of African American Studies scholars has contributed to the understanding of developments such as those depicted in the source.
